hook.text: For centuries, sailors told of monstrous waves appearing from nowhere. Scientists dismissed them.

buildup.text: Normal waves are somewhat predictable. But occasionally, one is twice the expected height.

discovery.text: In 1995, a sensor on a North Sea platform recorded a 26-meter wave â€” proving rogues exist.

twist.text: Rogue waves aren't caused by storms alone. Wave interference can stack energy unexpectedly.

climax.text: Ships designed for 15-meter waves can be destroyed by a 30-meter rogue.

punchline.text: The sailors were right all along. The scientists took decades to believe them.

quiz.question: When were rogue waves first scientifically confirmed?
